title: Marco Silva does not fear for his job should Everton suffer fifth Premier League defeat in a row
text:
Marco Silva insists he will not be sacked even if Everton lose their fifth consecutive Premier League match and remain in the bottom three.

The Portuguese is under mounting pressure and faced ferocious criticism from Everton fans after they plunged into the relegation zone with a 1-0 defeat at Burnley before the international break; he described this afternoon's clash with West Ham as being 'must win' in the aftermath at Turf Moor.

Silva, who says he has met frequently with major shareholder Farhad Moshiri, is aware that he must turn the tide but he did not look like a man who was on the brink at Everton's Finch Farm training base and is confident his team will deliver the result he wants.

Everton boss Marco Silva has insisted that he will not be sacked even if they lose this weekend

The Portuguese is under increasing pressure at Goodison having lost four games in a row

Asked if he feared his job was on the line, Silva said: 'I don't think in this situation. It is not something that is ever in my mind because when I'm winning five or six games I'm not thinking if I win I will renew the contract and get three years more.

'It is something that doesn't stay in my mind. A football manager doesn't have to lose one second to even think in this situation.

Silva has frequently met with owner Farhad Moshiri and is confident about his position

'We have to go with 'we worked well during the week, we have planned everything well, tomorrow our players they will perform well playing in our stadium and we have to show togetherness to win a football match.'

Silva added: 'We have to play with heart, we have to play with the atmosphere in our stadium but we also have to be patient. It is in our mind to win the match, be calm when we have to be and showing the desire to win the game.'
